name: Best Carolina BBQ Meat Sauce
author: TRIPPER
summary: I can't take all the credit for this stuff. I have had to search, and snoop and experiment to get it right. (Thanks Big Daddy's!)  But I've had barbeque in some of the best little places in the Carolina's, and this stuff rules there! Fantastic on pork! Or try brushing some on chicken as it finishes off the grill!  Use fresh ground peppers for the best flavor. This will keep in fridge for a couple of weeks.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon Louisiana-style hot sauce, or to taste
directions: In a heavy non-reactive saucepan, stir together the mustard, brown sugar, vinegar, and beer
Season with chili powder and black, white, and cayenne peppers
Bring to a simmer over medium-low heat, and cook for about 20 minutes
DO NOT BOIL, or you will scorch the sugar and peppers
Mix in the Worcestershire sauce, butter, and liquid smoke
Taste, and season with hot sauce to your liking
Pour into an airtight jar, and refrigerate for overnight to allow flavors to blend
The vinegar taste may be a little strong until the sauce completely cools
